name: Email
description: The Email Connector allows you to list, send emails and perform other actions such as mark email as read, mark email as deleted, delete email and expunge folder on different mailboxes using protocols IMAP, POP3 and SMTP.

params.name: folder
params.description: Name of the mailbox folder where the emails with the DELETED flag are scheduled to be permanently deleted

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: emailId
params.description: Index of the email to be retrieved in the email response

params.name: folder
params.description: Folder to be searched for the email

params.name: attachmentIndex
params.description: Index of the attachment to be retrieved in the email response

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: folder
params.description: Name of the Mailbox folder to retrieve emails from

params.name: deleteAfterRetrieve
params.description: Whether the email should be deleted after retrieving

params.name: offset
params.description: The index from which to retrieve emails

params.name: limit
params.description: The number of emails to be retrieved

params.name: receivedSince
params.description: The date after which to retrieve received emails

params.name: receivedUntil
params.description: The date until which to retrieve received emails

params.name: sentSince
params.description: The date after which to retrieve sent emails

params.name: sentUntil
params.description: The date until which to retrieve sent emails

params.name: subjectRegex
params.description: Subject Regex to match with the wanted emails

params.name: fromRegex
params.description: From email address to match with the wanted emails

params.name: seen
params.description: Whether to retrieve 'seen' or 'not seen' emails

params.name: answered
params.description: Whether to retrieve 'answered' or 'unanswered' emails

params.name: deleted
params.description: Whether to retrieve 'deleted' or 'not deleted' emails

params.name: recent
params.description: Whether to retrieve 'recent' or 'past' emails

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: folder
params.description: Name of the Mailbox folder to retrieve emails from

params.name: emailId
params.description: Email ID Number of the email to mark as deleted

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: folder
params.description: Name of the Mailbox folder to retrieve emails from

params.name: emailId
params.description: Email ID Number of the email to mark as read

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: from
params.description: The 'From' address of the message sender

params.name: to
params.description: The recipient addresses of 'To' (primary) type

params.name: personalName
params.description: The personal name of the message sender

params.name: cc
params.description: The recipient addresses of 'CC' (carbon copy) type

params.name: bcc
params.description: The recipient addresses of 'BCC' (blind carbon copy) type

params.name: replyTo
params.description: The email addresses to which to reply to this email

params.name: subject
params.description: The subject of the email

params.name: content
params.description: Body of the message in any format

params.name: contentType
params.description: Content Type of the body

params.name: encoding
params.description: The character encoding of the body

params.name: contentTransferEncoding
params.description: Encoding used to indicate the type of transformation that is used to represent the body in an acceptable manner for transport

params.name: attachments
params.description: Comma separated file paths of the attachments that are sent along with the email body

params.name: inlineImages
params.description: Array of comma separated inline images that should be embedded inline to email body

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: folder
params.description: Name of the Mailbox folder to retrieve emails from

params.name: emailId
params.description: Email ID Number of the email to delete

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: emailId
params.description: Index of the email to be retrieved in the email response

params.name: folder
params.description: Folder to be searched for the email

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the email connection

params.name: host
params.description: Host name of the mail server

params.name: port
params.description: The port number of the mail server

params.name: requireAuthentication
params.description: Whether authentication is required to connect with SMTP server

params.name: username
params.description: Username used to connect with the mail server

params.name: password
params.description: Password to connect with the mail server

params.name: readTimeout
params.description: The socket read timeout value

params.name: connectionTimeout
params.description: The socket connection timeout value

params.name: writeTimeout
params.description: The socket write timeout value

params.name: maxActiveConnections
params.description: Maximum number of active connections in the pool

params.name: maxIdleConnections
params.description: Maximum number of idle connections in the pool

params.name: maxWaitTime
params.description: Maximum time to wait for a pooled component to become available

params.name: minEvictionTime
params.description: The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction

params.name: evictionCheckInterval
params.description: The number of milliseconds between runs of the object evictor

params.name: exhaustedAction
params.description: The behavior of the pool when the pool is exhausted

params.name: enableOAuth2
params.description: Whether to enable OAuth2 Authentication

params.name: grantType
params.description: Grant type to generate access token Supported values: AUTHORIZATION_CODE, CLIENT_CREDENTIALS

params.name: clientId
params.description: Value of the Client ID you obtained when you register your application

params.name: clientSecret
params.description: Value of the Client Secret you obtained when you register your application

params.name: refreshToken
params.description: The refresh token generated (This is applicable for grant type AUTHORIZATION_CODE)

params.name: tokenUrl
params.description: The token endpoint URL to generate access token

params.name: scope
params.description: Scope (This is applicable for grant type CLIENT_CREDENTIALS)

operations.name: expungeFolder
operations.description: Delete all the messages scheduled for deletion with the DELETED flag set from the mailbox.

operations.name: markAsDeleted
operations.description: Mark an incoming email as DELETED. Not physically deleted, only a state change.

operations.name: markAsRead
operations.description: Marks a single email as READ changing its state in the specified mailbox folder.

connections.name: POP3
connections.description: Connection for retrieving emails via POP3.

connections.name: POP3S
connections.description: Secure connection for retrieving emails via POP3S.

connections.name: IMAP
connections.description: Connection for accessing emails via IMAP.

connections.name: IMAPS
connections.description: Secure connection for accessing emails via IMAPS.

connections.name: SMTP
connections.description: Connection for sending emails via SMTP.

connections.name: SMTPS
connections.description: Secure connection for sending emails via SMTPS.
